content.div: It's Oscar time! The Academy Award nominations announcement took place on Jan. 24 — did your favourites make the cut? Postmedia's Jay Stone and Dose.ca's Jen McDonnell discussed the nominations...from the surprises to the snubs and everything in between. Replay the live chat below.

entry.title: Oscar Nominations: The 20 Biggest Snubs and Surprises

link.Abstract: Who got a surprise nomination? Who was left off the list? Check out our reaction to the 2012 Academy Awards nominations.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Oscar Snub - Best Picture: No Nomination for Bridesmaids With the new rules surrounding this year's Best Picture nominees (the voting system changed to a preferential ballot), many believed that the number of films wouldn't be anywhere close to last year's 10. So it was a surprise that nine movies made it onto the list (most seemed to think there'd be seven). And still, even with a greater than expected number of nominees, the crowd-pleaser Bridesmaids didn't make the cut. Apparently, being universally loved and financially successful wasn't enough to woo stuffy Academy voters, who instead opted to nominate the box office disappointment Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close. We guess we should just be happy with Melissa McCarthy's Best Supporting Actress nod. It's not every day the Academy recognizes a sink-pooping scene stealer.
link.title: Oscar Snub - Best Picture: No Nomination for Bridesmaids

link.Abstract: Silent film The Artist was came out as the top nominee during the Golden Globes nominations announcement Thursday morning. George Clooney film The Descendants and Emma Stone's The Help were recognized with five nods apiece.
link.title: A Moment of Silence, Please, For the Golden Globes Nominations; The Artist, The Descendants Lead Nods

entry.title: Golden Globes 2012 – Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: From photobombs to penis jokes, take a look at the highs and lows from the Golden Globe Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Worst Joke by Ricky Gervais Going where many had before, host Ricky Gervais made a tired joke about how presenter Madonna can no longer act “Like a Virgin.” Madge retorted by saying, “If I’m still a virgin, Ricky, than why don’t you come over here and do something about it?” which led to the best sight gag of the night: a scared-looking Gervais running across the stage.
link.title: Worst Joke by Ricky GervaisGoing where many had before, host Ricky Gervais made a tired joke about how presenter Madonna can no longer act “Like a Virgin.” Madge retorted by saying, “If I’m still a virgin, Ricky, than why don’t you come over here and do something about it?” which led to the best sight gag of the night: a scared-looking Gervais running across the stage.
